"but it now seems some things are reopening"The only thing that is reopening in Italy at present is the debate on when things are going to reopen. I’ve only skimmed through the headlines of the newspapers this morning but one I saw said that scientists were putting the brakes on Conte’s plans to permit certain key industries to re-start next month, and it would surely be safe to say that when non-industrial operations do recommence, it will be on a very gradual basis and prioritized. I could be wrong, but I wouldn't have thought that museums, cinemas or theatres are a priority for anyone, and even if social distancing was introduced in the latter two, I'm not sure anyone I know, myself included, would be rushing to buy a ticket anytime soon.BTW, as a Brit, I'm chuffed to read that Drew in the US follows the BBC for news, the "Beeb" being one of the country's most precious institutions.
Learned a new word - chuffed. Yes, much overseas news is more accurate than the US govt Newspeak.
